setTableRemarks.remarks: a bridge (or closure) table which stores information for quick hierarchy traversals

setColumnRemarks.remarks: type of entity this record represents (ORG_UNIT, MEASURABLE, etc)
the id of the descendant (lower) entity in the hierarchy
the id of the ancestor (higher) entity in the hierarchy
the depth of the ancestor
the depth of the descendant

changeSet.author: davidwatkins73
changeSet.sql: update entity_hierarchy a set descendant_level = ( select b.level from entity_hierarchy b where b.id = a.id and b.ancestor_id = a.id and b.kind = a.kind);

changeSet.author: davidwatkins73
changeSet.sql: with a as ( select * from entity_hierarchy ) update a set descendant_level = ( select b.level from entity_hierarchy b where b.id = a.id and b.ancestor_id = a.id and b.kind = a.kind);

setTableRemarks.remarks: contains configuration data which controls the operation of Waltz.

setColumnRemarks.remarks: the key name of the setting, often uses dotted notation. Strongly recommended to put client specific settings under their own namespace (i.e. mycorp.somesetting)
the value of the setting, if the setting is a boolean it should be entered as lowercase
restricted settings are internal to Waltz and not available via API/external calls
optional comment to describe this setting

setTableRemarks.remarks: logs user page and section views

setColumnRemarks.remarks: identifier of the user accessing the page or section
identifier of the page plus optionally a section identifier (format: state|section)
additional params provided to page/section

setTableRemarks.remarks: represents a non application entity, typically used in flows. Examples include exchanges, departments, counterpart organisations

setColumnRemarks.remarks: short name identifying the actor (i.e. Bank of England)
longer textual description of the actor
flag to indicate whether this is an internal actor (e.g. Chief Risk Officer) or external actor (e.g. Bank of England)
where did this actor record originate, will be 'waltz' if provided via the UI
identifier this actor is known by externally. Should not change, unlike the name which may change.

setTableRemarks.remarks: allocations are used to apportion shares of a particular scheme (i.e. TCO) against an entity (e.g. applications) and measurable. The total for a given scheme and entity should be lte 100

setColumnRemarks.remarks: identifier (and fk) to a particular allocation scheme
identifier of the entity this allocation refers to
kind of the entity (e.g. APPLICATION) this allocation refers to
which measurable is being given an allocation for this entity
the allocation percentage given to this entity/measurable

setTableRemarks.remarks: allocation_schemes provide a named definition which allows entities to record allocations against a particular measurable category. (e.g. the 'Function Cost Shred' would be for applications to record allocations against their Functional Taxonomy measurable mappings)

setColumnRemarks.remarks: short name describing this allocation scheme (i.e. 'Function Cost Shred')
longer description to provide more information about this allocation scheme
defines the category of measurables this allocation scheme refers to
typically used when setting allocations via external batch processes (e.g. 'FT_COST')

setTableRemarks.remarks: represents an application (with an entity_kind of 'APPLICATION')

setColumnRemarks.remarks: name of this application (aliases can be added in the entity_alias table)
longer description to provide more information about this application. Markdown is supported
external identifier representing this application
reference to the owning org unit
broad category of this application (e.g. IN_HOUSE, EXTERNALLY_HOSTED, THIRD_PARTY, EUC, etc)
the current application lifecycle state of this application (one of: CONCEPTUAL, DEVELOPMENT, PRODUCTION, RETIRED)
asset code of any parent application
investment rating scheme (one of: R, A, G, Z / which equates to Disinvest, Maintain, Invest, Unknown)
origination of this application record. Will be 'waltz' if entered via the UI
business criticality of this application (one of: LOW, MEDIUM, HIGH, VERY_HIGH, NONE, UNKNOWN)
should this record logically be treated as if it has been physically deleted
the lifecycle state of this entity record, slightly different from is_removed as does not imply the record is 'gone' (one of: ACTIVE, PENDING, REMOVED)
date when this application is (or was) planning to retire
date when this application actually retired from production, null if not planned
when was this application commissioned, null if unknown

setTableRemarks.remarks: represents an ad-hoc collection of applications

setColumnRemarks.remarks: display name for the group
the type of group (one of: PUBLIC, PRIVATE). Note, private groups can still be seen, they are merely unlisted in the UI
longer description of the group, supports markdown
external identifier, typically used when creating/syncing groups via external jobs
flag indicating if the group has been deleted
a favourite group is assigned to each user to allow them to quickly bookmark apps and populate the change calendar on the homepage

setTableRemarks.remarks: a reference to a specific application in a group

setColumnRemarks.remarks: reference to the group this entry belongs to
reference to the application this entry refers to
flag to indicate that the value is readonly. Typically set if group entries are added by external jobs
indicates where this record originated. Will be 'waltz' if created via the UI
the date this entry was created, sometimes used to 'age' entries out the group, i.e. in exception lists

setTableRemarks.remarks: users granted viewer or ownership rights to app groups

setColumnRemarks.remarks: reference to the group this member belongs to
reference to the user id of the group member
the role of the user in the group (one of: VIEWER, OWNER)

setTableRemarks.remarks: app groups can include reference to org units. Apps associated to the org unit are included in the group at runtime

setColumnRemarks.remarks: reference to the group this entry belongs to
reference to the org unit this entry belongs to
flag to indicate that the value is readonly. Typically set if group entries are added by external jobs
indicates where this record originated. Will be 'waltz' if created via the UI
the date this entry was created

setTableRemarks.remarks: assessments are used to record enumerated data points against apps. The definition describes each type of definition, linking to the applicable entity types and possible values.

setColumnRemarks.remarks: display name for this assessment definition
external identifier, typically used when external jobs are updating the associated ratings
reference to the rating scheme which provides the acceptable values for this assessment
the kind of entity the assessment can be associated with (typically the _main_ entities: APPLICATION, CHANGE_INITIATIVE, etc
longer description of this assessment. Markdown is supported
if defined, only users with this role can update the definition
flag inidcating that the record is read only. Typically set if the assessment values are mastered outside of Waltz and updated via an external job
where this definition came from. Will be 'waltz' if created via the UI

indicates if this assessment should be included in the users primary, short-list by default (permissible values are: PRIMARY, SECONDARY). Note: users are free to remove assessments from their short lists.

setTableRemarks.remarks: an individual rating, linking an entity (e.g. app) to an assessment and value

setColumnRemarks.remarks: the entity kind of the entity being assessed and rated (typically APPLICATION or CHANGE_INITIATVE)
the entity id of the entity being assessed and rated
reference to the assessment definition being assessed for this rating record
reference to the rating scheme item, providing the value of this assessment rating. Note: this should be one of the scheme items defined within the rating scheme of the assessment definition
optional user provided comment
where this rating came from. Will be 'waltz' if created via the UI

setTableRemarks.remarks: a specific attestation of an entity for a particular kind (e.g. an APPLICATION for LOGICAL_FLOWs)

setColumnRemarks.remarks: reference to the attestation run which owns this instance
the identifier of the entity being attested
the type of entity being attested
the date/time the attestation occured
who initiated the attestation
what was being attested for the parent entity (typically: MEASURABLE, LOGICAL_FLOW, PHYSICAL_FLOW)

setTableRemarks.remarks: associates an attestation instance to a user who is responsible for doing the attestation

setColumnRemarks.remarks: reference to the attestation instance
the user responsible for doing the attestations

setTableRemarks.remarks: an attestation run defines the parameters needed to orchestrate an attestation cycle against multiple entities

setColumnRemarks.remarks: the kind of entities which are being attested (i.e. APPLICATION or CHANGE_INITIAIVE)
display name for the run
descriptive text for the run. Markdown is supported
the selector defines which entity is used to derive the set of entities (e.g. apps) being attested. This is the kind of that selector entity (e.g. ORG_UNIT)
the selector defines which entity is used to derive the set of entities (e.g. apps) being attested. This is the id of that selector entity (e.g. 32)
if the selector points at a hierarchical entity, this part indicates whether to match against EXACT, CHILDREN, or PARENT entities
attestation instances are issued against individuals via their involvement roles. This is a delimited list containing the involvement_kind identifiers
user id of the issuer
the date the attestation was issued
the date the attestations should be completed by
indicates what releated entity is being attestated for the target entity kind. e.g. LOGICAL_FLOW, MEASURABLE_CATEGORY
if the attested entity kind needs a qualifier then this optional identifier provides that (e.g. category 12)
status of the attestation run (one of: DRAFT, PENDING, ISSUING, ISSUED, INVALID)
where this run came from. Will be 'waltz' if created via the UI

setTableRemarks.remarks: defines a particular type of involvement a person may have in relation to an entity (e.g. IT Owner for an APPLICATION)

setColumnRemarks.remarks: display name for the involvement kind
longer textual description of the involvement
flag to allow users to add people to an entity with this involvement (set to false to restrict usage, i.e. if involvement is mastered in another system)
external identifier, typically used when external jobs are updating the associated involvements

setTableRemarks.remarks: defines a specific instance of an involvement kind between a person and an entity (e.g. 'User X' is 'IT Owner' for 'APPLICATION/32')

setColumnRemarks.remarks: where did this involvement record originate, will be 'waltz' if provided via the UI
the identifier of the entity the person is involved with
the kind of entity the person is involved with
reference to the person involved with the entity
the type of involvement between the person and the entity (e.g. 'IT Owner')
can this involvement be edited/removed by users (e.g. set to true if externally mastered)
